Are We Being Bad Citizens If We Don't Keep Up With the News?

In your opinion, are we being bad citizens if we don't keep up with the news? Do you think all people have some responsibility to know what is going on in the world? Does engaging with current events actually do anything at all? Why do you think the way you do?

In your opinion, are we being bad citizens if we don't keep up with the news? Do you think all people have some responsibility to know what is going on in the world? Does engaging with current events actually do anything at all? Why do you think the way you do?

---

In my opinion, while yes engaging with the news and current events helps us keep up on the world, it does not by any means make us bad citizens if we don't. I think it is okay to take a break of news sometimes. Often times we just hear about all the bad things going on in the world, or our country. More than likely, like myself, people get sick and tired of hearing all the violence and terrorism around the world and just want to tune out and not dwell on it, and focus on the positives in their life.

It's almost impossible to not know what's in the news this day and age anyways, due to word of mouth and stuff like that. In your opinion, are we being bad citizens if we don't keep up with the news? Do you think all people have some responsibility to know what is going on in the world? Does engaging with current events actually do anything at all? Why do you think the way you do?

---

In my opinion, while yes engaging with the news and current events helps us keep up on the world, it does not by any means make us bad citizens if we don't. I think it is okay to take a break of news sometimes. Often times we just hear about all the bad things going on in the world, or our country. More than likely, like myself, people get sick and tired of hearing all the violence and terrorism around the world and just want to tune out and not dwell on it, and focus on the positives in their life.

It's almost impossible to not know what's in the news this day and age anyways, due to word of mouth and stuff like that. You always have a friend or family member telling people what they had in the news anyways. The same goes with social media. Are We Being Bad Citizens If We Don't Keep Up With the News?

In your opinion, are we being bad citizens if we don't keep up with the news? Do you think all people have some responsibility to know what is going on in the world? Does engaging with current events actually do anything at all? Why do you think the way you do?

---

In my opinion, while yes engaging with the news and current events helps us keep up on the world, it does not by any means make us bad citizens if we don't. I think it is okay to take a break of news sometimes. Often times we just hear about all the bad things going on in the world, or our country. More than likely, like myself, people get sick and tired of hearing all the violence and terrorism around the world and just want to tune out and not dwell on it, and focus on the positives in their life.

In your opinion, are we being bad citizens if we don't keep up with the news? Do you think all people have some responsibility to know what is going on in the world? Does engaging with current events actually do anything at all? Why do you think the way you do?

---

In my opinion, while yes engaging with the news and current events helps us keep up on the world, it does not by any means make us bad citizens if we don't. I think it is okay to take a break of news sometimes. Often times we just hear about all the bad things going on in the world, or our country. More than likely, like myself, people get sick and tired of hearing all the violence and terrorism around the world and just want to tune out and not dwell on it, and focus on the positives in their life.

It's almost impossible to not know what's in the news this day and age anyways, due to word of mouth and stuff like that. You always have a friend or family member telling people what they had in the news anyways. The same goes with social media. All throughout social media you see stuff about the news, and people will not hesitate to share it with their followers. So it's hard to avoid. But who can blame a person for wanting to tune out all the negative news and hear something good in their life anyways.

In your opinion, are we being bad citizens if we don't keep up with the news? Do you think all people have some responsibility to know what is going on in the world? Does engaging with current events actually do anything at all? Why do you think the way you do?

---

In my opinion, while yes engaging with the news and current events helps us keep up on the world, it does not by any means make us bad citizens if we don't. I think it is okay to take a break of news sometimes. Often times we just hear about all the bad things going on in the world, or our country. More than likely, like myself, people get sick and tired of hearing all the violence and terrorism around the world and just want to tune out and not dwell on it, and focus on the positives in their life.

It's almost impossible to not know what's in the news this day and age anyways, due to word of mouth and stuff like that. You always have a friend or family member telling people what they had in the news anyways. The same goes with social media. All throughout social media you see stuff about the news, and people will not hesitate to share it with their followers. So it's hard to avoid. But who can blame a person for wanting to tune out all the negative news and hear something good in their life anyways. 
Do I believe there is a responsibility to know what is going on in the world?
 No, I do no

Are We Being Bad Citizens If We Don't Keep Up With the News?

In your opinion, are we being bad citizens if we don't keep up with the news? Do you think all people have some responsibility to know what is going on in the world? Does engaging with current events actually do anything at all? Why do you think the way you do?

---

In my opinion, while yes engaging with the news and current events helps us keep up on the world, it does not by any means make us bad citizens if we don't. I think it is okay to take a break of news sometimes. Often times we just hear about all the bad things going on in the world, or our country. More than likely, like myself, people get sick and tired of hearing all the violence and terrorism around the world and just want to tune out and not dwell on it, and focus on the positives in their life.

 No, I do not. I feel there are plenty of other people out there who do

More than likely, like myself, people get sick and tired of hearing all the violence and terrorism around the world and just want to tune out and not dwell on it, and focus on the positives in their life.

It's almost impossible to not know what's in the news this day and age anyways, due to word of mouth and stuff like that. You always have a friend or family member telling people what they had in the news anyways. The same goes with social media. All throughout social media you see stuff about the news, and people will not hesitate to share it with their followers. So it's hard to avoid. But who can blame a person for wanting to tune out all the negative news and hear something good in their life anyways. 
Do I believe there is a responsibility to know what is going on in the world?
 No, I do not. I feel there are plenty of other people out there who do enough worrying about eve

In your opinion, are we being bad citizens if we don't keep up with the news? Do you think all people have some responsibility to know what is going on in the world? Does engaging with current events actually do anything at all? Why do you think the way you do?

---

In my opinion, while yes engaging with the news and current events helps us keep up on the world, it does not by any means make us bad citizens if we don't. I think it is okay to take a break of news sometimes. Often times we just hear about all the bad things going on in the world, or our country. More than likely, like myself, people get sick and tired of hearing all the violence and terrorism around the world and just want to tune out and not dwell on it, and focus on the positives in their life.

It's almost impossible to not know what's in the news this day and age anyways, due to word of mouth and stuff like that. You always have a friend or family member telling people what they had in the news anyways. The same goes with social media. All throughout social media you see stuff about the news, and people will not hesitate to share it with their followers. So it's hard to avoid. But who can blame a person for wanting to tune out all the negative news and hear something good in their life anyways. 
Do I believe there is a responsibility to know what is going on in the world?
 No, I do not. I feel there are plenty of other people out there who do enough worrying about everything. I feel you should save your energy from worrying, and use it to purify your soul and become a better person. If more people

Are We Being Bad Citizens If We Don't Keep Up With the News?

In your opinion, are we being bad citizens if we don't keep up with the news? Do you think all people have some responsibility to know what is going on in the world? Does engaging with current events actually do anything at all? Why do you think the way you do?

---

In my opinion, while yes engaging with the news and current events helps us keep up on the world, it does not by any means make us bad citizens if we don't. I think it is okay to take a break of news sometimes. Often times we just hear about all the bad things going on in the world, or our country. More than likely, like myself, people get sick and tired of hearing all the violence and terrorism around the world and just want to tune out and not dwell on it, and focus on the positives in their life.

It's almost impossible to not know what's in the news this day and age anyways, due to word of mouth and stuff like that. You always have a friend or family member telling people what they had in the news anyways. The same goes with social media. All throughout social media you see stuff about the news, and people will not hesitate to share it with their followers. So it's hard to avoid. But who can blame a person for wanting to tune out all the negative news and hear something good in their life anyways.

 No, I do not. I feel there are plenty of other people out there who do enough worrying about everything. I feel you should save your energy from worrying, and use it to purify your soul and become a better person. If more people did that, maybe they woul

It's almost impossible to not know what's in the news this day and age anyways, due to word of mouth and stuff like that. You always have a friend or family member telling people what they had in the news anyways. The same goes with social media. All throughout social media you see stuff about the news, and people will not hesitate to share it with their followers. So it's hard to avoid. But who can blame a person for wanting to tune out all the negative news and hear something good in their life anyways. 
Do I believe there is a responsibility to know what is going on in the world?
 No, I do not. I feel there are plenty of other people out there who do enough worrying about everything. I feel you should save your energy from worrying, and use it to purify your soul and become a better person. If more people did that, maybe they would become better citizen

Are We Being Bad Citizens If We Don't Keep Up With the News?

In your opinion, are we being bad citizens if we don't keep up with the news? Do you think all people have some responsibility to know what is going on in the world? Does engaging with current events actually do anything at all? Why do you think the way you do?

---

In my opinion, while yes engaging with the news and current events helps us keep up on the world, it does not by any means make us bad citizens if we don't. I think it is okay to take a break of news sometimes. Often times we just hear about all the bad things going on in the world, or our country. More than likely, like myself, people get sick and tired of hearing all the violence and terrorism around the world and just want to tune out and not dwell on it, and focus on the positives in their life.

It's almost impossible to not know what's in the news this day and age anyways, due to word of mouth and stuff like that. You always have a friend or family member telling people what they had in the news anyways. The same goes with social media. All throughout social media you see stuff about the news, and people will not hesitate to share it with their followers. So it's hard to avoid. But who can blame a person for wanting to tune out all the negative news and hear something good in their life anyways. 
Do I believe there is a responsibility to know what is going on in the world?
 No, I do not. I feel there are plenty of other people out there who do enough worrying about everything. I feel you should save your energy from worrying, and use it to purify your soul and become a better person. If more people did that, maybe they would become better citizens, who knows.

 No, I do not. I feel there are plenty of other people out there who do enough worrying about everything. I feel you should save your energy from worrying, and use it to purify your soul and become a better person. If more people did that, maybe they would become better citizens, who knows.

Are We Being Bad Citizens If We Don't Keep Up With the News?

In my opinion, while yes engaging with the news and current events helps us keep up on the world, it does not by any means make us bad citizens if we don't. I think it is okay to take a break of news sometimes. Often times we just hear about all the bad things going on in the world, or our country. More than likely, like myself, people get sick and tired of hearing all the violence and terrorism around the world and just want to tune out and not dwell on it, and focus on the positives in their life.

More than likely, like myself, people get sick and tired of hearing all the violence and terrorism around the world and just want to tune out and not dwell on it, and focus on the positives in their life.

It's almost impossible to not know what's in the news this day and age anyways, due to word of mouth and stuff like that. You always have a friend or family member telling people what they had in the news anyways. The same goes with social media. All throughout social media you see stuff about the news, and people will not hesitate to share it with their followers. So it's hard to avoid. But who can blame a person for wanting to tune out all the negative news and hear something good in their life anyways. 
Do I believe there is a responsibility to know what is going on in the world?
 No, I do not. I feel there are plenty of other people out there who do enough worrying about everything. I feel you should save your energy from worrying, and use it to purify your soul and become a better person. If more people did that, maybe they would become better citizens, who knows.

Are We Being Bad Citizens If We Don't Keep Up With the News?

In your opinion, are we being bad citizens if we don't keep up with the news? Do you think all people have some responsibility to know what is going on in the world? Does engaging with current events actually do anything at all? Why do you think the way you do?

---

In my opinion, while yes engaging with the news and current events helps us keep up on the world, it does not by any means make us bad citizens if we don't. I think it is okay to take a break of news sometimes. Often times we just hear about all the bad things going on in the world, or our country. More than likely, like myself, people get sick and tired of hearing all the violence and terrorism around the world and just want to tune out and not dwell on it, and focus on the positives in their life.

It's almost impossible to not know what's in the news this day and age anyways, due to word of mouth and stuff like that. You always have a friend or family member telling people what they had in the news anyways. The same goes with social media. All throughout social media you see stuff about the news, and people will not hesitate to share it with their followers. So it's hard to avoid. ---

In my opinion, while yes engaging with the news and current events helps us keep up on the world, it does not by any means make us bad citizens if we don't. I think it is okay to take a break of news sometimes. Often times we just hear about all the bad things going on in the world, or our country. More than likely, like myself, people get sick and tired of hearing all the violence and terrorism around the world and just want to tune out and not dwell on it, and focus on the positives in their life.

It's almost impossible to not know what's in the news this day and age anyways, due to word of mouth and stuff like that. You always have a friend or family member telling people what they had in the news anyways. The same goes with social media. All throughout social media you see stuff about the news, and people will not hesitate to share it with their followers. So it's hard to avoid. But who can blame a person for wanting to tune out all the negative news and hear something good in their life anyways. 
Do I believe there is a responsibility to know what is going on in the world?
 No, I do not. I feel there are plenty of other people out there who do enough worrying about everything. I feel you should save your energy from worrying, and use it to purify your soul and become a better person. If more people did that, maybe they would become better citizens, who knows. 

Even more so, many people only focus on specific types of news anyways and tune everything else out. I'

In my opinion, while yes engaging with the news and current events helps us keep up on the world, it does not by any means make us bad citizens if we don't. I think it is okay to take a break of news sometimes. Often times we just hear about all the bad things going on in the world, or our country. More than likely, like myself, people get sick and tired of hearing all the violence and terrorism around the world and just want to tune out and not dwell on it, and focus on the positives in their life.

It's almost impossible to not know what's in the news this day and age anyways, due to word of mouth and stuff like that. You always have a friend or family member telling people what they had in the news anyways. The same goes with social media. All throughout social media you see stuff about the news, and people will not hesitate to share it with their followers. So it's hard to avoid. But who can blame a person for wanting to tune out all the negative news and hear something good in their life anyways. 
Do I believe there is a responsibility to know what is going on in the world?
 No, I do not. I feel there are plenty of other people out there who do enough worrying about everything. I feel you should save your energy from worrying, and use it to purify your soul and become a better person. If more people did that, maybe they would become better citizens, who knows. 

Even more so, many people only focus on specific types of news anyways and tune everything else out. I'm sure they feel they ar

 No, I do not. I feel there are plenty of other people out there who do enough worrying about everything. I feel you should save your energy from worrying, and use it to purify your soul and become a better person. If more people did that, maybe they would become better citizens, who knows. 

Even more so, many people only focus on specific types of news anyways and tune everything else out. I'm sure they feel they are not bad people. 
Maybe they don'ealize that tuning out some news would greatly help them escape from some of their worries and lessen stress on their lives.

Are We Being Bad Citizens If We Don't Keep Up With the News?

In your opinion, are we being bad citizens if we don't keep up with the news? Do you think all people have some responsibility to know what is going on in the world? Does engaging with current events actually do anything at all? Why do you think the way you do?

---

In my opinion, while yes engaging with the news and current events helps us keep up on the world, it does not by any means make us bad citizens if we don't. I think it is okay to take a break of news sometimes. Often times we just hear about all the bad things going on in the world, or our country. More than likely, like myself, people get sick and tired of hearing all the violence and terrorism around the world and just want to tune out and not dwell on it, and focus on the positives in their life.

It's almost impossible to not know what's in the news this day and age anyways, due to word of mouth and stuff like that. You always have a friend or family member telling people what they had in the news anyways. The same goes with social media. All throughout social media you see stuff about the news, and people will not hesitate to share it with their followers. So it's hard to avoid. But who can blame a person for wanting to tune out all the negative news and hear something good in their life anyways.

Even more so, many people only focus on specific types of news anyways and tune everything else out. I'm sure they feel they are not bad people. 
Maybe they donealize that tuning out some news would greatly help them escape from some of their worries and lessen stress on their lives.

In my opinion, while yes engaging with the news and current events helps us keep up on the world, it does not by any means make us bad citizens if we don't. I think it is okay to take a break of news sometimes. Often times we just hear about all the bad things going on in the world, or our country. More than likely, like myself, people get sick and tired of hearing all the violence and terrorism around the world and just want to tune out and not dwell on it, and focus on the positives in their life.

It's almost impossible to not know what's in the news this day and age anyways, due to word of mouth and stuff like that. You always have a friend or family member telling people what they had in the news anyways. The same goes with social media. All throughout social media you see stuff about the news, and people will not hesitate to share it with their followers. So it's hard to avoid. But who can blame a person for wanting to tune out all the negative news and hear something good in their life anyways. 
Do I believe there is a responsibility to know what is going on in the world?
 No, I do not. I feel there are plenty of other people out there who do enough worrying about everything. I feel you should save your energy from worrying, and use it to purify your soul and become a better person. If more people did that, maybe they would become better citizens, who knows. 

Even more so, many people only focus on specific types of news anyways and tune everything else out. I'm sure they feel they are not bad people. 
Maybe they dealize that tuning out some news would greatly help them escape from some of their worries and lessen stress on their lives.
 I have kids, and I k

More than likely, like myself, people get sick and tired of hearing all the violence and terrorism around the world and just want to tune out and not dwell on it, and focus on the positives in their life.

It's almost impossible to not know what's in the news this day and age anyways, due to word of mouth and stuff like that. You always have a friend or family member telling people what they had in the news anyways. The same goes with social media. All throughout social media you see stuff about the news, and people will not hesitate to share it with their followers. So it's hard to avoid. But who can blame a person for wanting to tune out all the negative news and hear something good in their life anyways. 
Do I believe there is a responsibility to know what is going on in the world?
 No, I do not. I feel there are plenty of other people out there who do enough worrying about everything. I feel you should save your energy from worrying, and use it to purify your soul and become a better person. If more people did that, maybe they would become better citizens, who knows. 

Even more so, many people only focus on specific types of news anyways and tune everything else out. I'm sure they feel they are not bad people. 
Maybe they dealize that tuning out some news would greatly help them escape from some of their worries and lessen stress on their lives.
 I have kids, and I know they don't even c

I think it is okay to take a break of news sometimes. Often times we just hear about all the bad things going on in the world, or our country. More than likely, like myself, people get sick and tired of hearing all the violence and terrorism around the world and just want to tune out and not dwell on it, and focus on the positives in their life.

It's almost impossible to not know what's in the news this day and age anyways, due to word of mouth and stuff like that. You always have a friend or family member telling people what they had in the news anyways. The same goes with social media. All throughout social media you see stuff about the news, and people will not hesitate to share it with their followers. So it's hard to avoid. But who can blame a person for wanting to tune out all the negative news and hear something good in their life anyways. 
Do I believe there is a responsibility to know what is going on in the world?
 No, I do not. I feel there are plenty of other people out there who do enough worrying about everything. I feel you should save your energy from worrying, and use it to purify your soul and become a better person. If more people did that, maybe they would become better citizens, who knows. 

Even more so, many people only focus on specific types of news anyways and tune everything else out. I'm sure they feel they are not bad people. 
Maybe they dealize that tuning out some news would greatly help them escape from some of their worries and lessen stress on their lives.
 I have kids, and I know they don't even care about the news on

In your opinion, are we being bad citizens if we don't keep up with the news? Do you think all people have some responsibility to know what is going on in the world? Does engaging with current events actually do anything at all? Why do you think the way you do?

---

In my opinion, while yes engaging with the news and current events helps us keep up on the world, it does not by any means make us bad citizens if we don't. I think it is okay to take a break of news sometimes. Often times we just hear about all the bad things going on in the world, or our country. More than likely, like myself, people get sick and tired of hearing all the violence and terrorism around the world and just want to tune out and not dwell on it, and focus on the positives in their life.

It's almost impossible to not know what's in the news this day and age anyways, due to word of mouth and stuff like that. You always have a friend or family member telling people what they had in the news anyways. The same goes with social media. All throughout social media you see stuff about the news, and people will not hesitate to share it with their followers. So it's hard to avoid. But who can blame a person for wanting to tune out all the negative news and hear something good in their life anyways. 
Do I believe there is a responsibility to know what is going on in the world?
 No, I do not. I feel there are plenty of other people out there who do enough worrying about everything. I feel you should save your energy from worrying, and use it to purify your soul and become a better person. If more people did that, maybe they would become better citizens, who knows. 

Even more so, many people only focus on specific types of news anyways and tune everything else out. I'm sure they feel they are not bad people. 
Maybe they dealize that tuning out some news would greatly help them escape from some of their worries and lessen stress on their lives.
 I have kids, and I know they don't even care about the news one little bit, unless

I think it is okay to take a break of news sometimes. Often times we just hear about all the bad things going on in the world, or our country. More than likely, like myself, people get sick and tired of hearing all the violence and terrorism around the world and just want to tune out and not dwell on it, and focus on the positives in their life.

It's almost impossible to not know what's in the news this day and age anyways, due to word of mouth and stuff like that. You always have a friend or family member telling people what they had in the news anyways. The same goes with social media. All throughout social media you see stuff about the news, and people will not hesitate to share it with their followers. So it's hard to avoid. But who can blame a person for wanting to tune out all the negative news and hear something good in their life anyways. 
Do I believe there is a responsibility to know what is going on in the world?
 No, I do not. I feel there are plenty of other people out there who do enough worrying about everything. I feel you should save your energy from worrying, and use it to purify your soul and become a better person. If more people did that, maybe they would become better citizens, who knows. 

Even more so, many people only focus on specific types of news anyways and tune everything else out. I'm sure they feel they are not bad people. 
Maybe they dealize that tuning out some news would greatly help them escape from some of their worries and lessen stress on their lives.
 I have kids, and I know they don't even care about the news one little bit, unless it has something to do with video games o

Are We Being Bad Citizens If We Don't Keep Up With the News?

In your opinion, are we being bad citizens if we don't keep up with the news? Do you think all people have some responsibility to know what is going on in the world? Does engaging with current events actually do anything at all? Why do you think the way you do?

---

In my opinion, while yes engaging with the news and current events helps us keep up on the world, it does not by any means make us bad citizens if we don't. I think it is okay to take a break of news sometimes. Often times we just hear about all the bad things going on in the world, or our country. More than likely, like myself, people get sick and tired of hearing all the violence and terrorism around the world and just want to tune out and not dwell on it, and focus on the positives in their life.

It's almost impossible to not know what's in the news this day and age anyways, due to word of mouth and stuff like that. You always have a friend or family member telling people what they had in the news anyways. The same goes with social media. All throughout social media you see stuff about the news, and people will not hesitate to share it with their followers. So it's hard to avoid. But who can blame a person for wanting to tune out all the negative news and hear something good in their life anyways. 
Do I believe there is a responsibility to know what is going on in the world?
 No, I do not. I feel there are plenty of other people out there who do enough worrying about everything. I feel you should save your energy from worrying, and use it to purify your soul and become a better person. If more people did that, maybe they would become better citizens, who knows. 

Even more so, many people only focus on specific types of news anyways and tune everything else out. I'm sure they feel they are not bad people. 
Maybe they dealize that tuning out some news would greatly help them escape from some of their worries and lessen stress on their lives.
 I have kids, and I know they don't even care about the news one little bit, unless it has something to do with video games of course. Just like all the other normal

Are We Being Bad Citizens If We Don't Keep Up With the News?

In your opinion, are we being bad citizens if we don't keep up with the news? Do you think all people have some responsibility to know what is going on in the world? Does engaging with current events actually do anything at all? Why do you think the way you do?

---

In my opinion, while yes engaging with the news and current events helps us keep up on the world, it does not by any means make us bad citizens if we don't. I think it is okay to take a break of news sometimes. Often times we just hear about all the bad things going on in the world, or our country. More than likely, like myself, people get sick and tired of hearing all the violence and terrorism around the world and just want to tune out and not dwell on it, and focus on the positives in their life.

It's almost impossible to not know what's in the news this day and age anyways, due to word of mouth and stuff like that. You always have a friend or family member telling people what they had in the news anyways. The same goes with social media. All throughout social media you see stuff about the news, and people will not hesitate to share it with their followers. So it's hard to avoid. But who can blame a person for wanting to tune out all the negative news and hear something good in their life anyways. 
Do I believe there is a responsibility to know what is going on in the world?
 No, I do not. I feel there are plenty of other people out there who do enough worrying about everything. I feel you should save your energy from worrying, and use it to purify your soul and become a better person. If more people did that, maybe they would become better citizens, who knows. 

Even more so, many people only focus on specific types of news anyways and tune everything else out. I'm sure they feel they are not bad people. 
Maybe they dealize that tuning out some news would greatly help them escape from some of their worries and lessen stress on their lives.
 I have kids, and I know they don't even care about the news one little bit, unless it has something to do with video games of course. Just like all the other normal kids. i don't think

Are We Being Bad Citizens If We Don't Keep Up With the News?

In your opinion, are we being bad citizens if we don't keep up with the news? Do you think all people have some responsibility to know what is going on in the world? Does engaging with current events actually do anything at all? Why do you think the way you do?

---

In my opinion, while yes engaging with the news and current events helps us keep up on the world, it does not by any means make us bad citizens if we don't. I think it is okay to take a break of news sometimes. Often times we just hear about all the bad things going on in the world, or our country. More than likely, like myself, people get sick and tired of hearing all the violence and terrorism around the world and just want to tune out and not dwell on it, and focus on the positives in their life.

It's almost impossible to not know what's in the news this day and age anyways, due to word of mouth and stuff like that. You always have a friend or family member telling people what they had in the news anyways. The same goes with social media. All throughout social media you see stuff about the news, and people will not hesitate to share it with their followers. So it's hard to avoid. But who can blame a person for wanting to tune out all the negative news and hear something good in their life anyways. 
Do I believe there is a responsibility to know what is going on in the world?
 No, I do not. I feel there are plenty of other people out there who do enough worrying about everything. I feel you should save your energy from worrying, and use it to purify your soul and become a better person. If more people did that, maybe they would become better citizens, who knows. 

Even more so, many people only focus on specific types of news anyways and tune everything else out. I'm sure they feel they are not bad people. 
Maybe they dealize that tuning out some news would greatly help them escape from some of their worries and lessen stress on their lives.
 I have kids, and I know they don't even care about the news one little bit, unless it has something to do with video games of course. Just like all the other normal kids. i don't think they are bad citize

Even more so, many people only focus on specific types of news anyways and tune everything else out. I'm sure they feel they are not bad people. 
Maybe they dealize that tuning out some news would greatly help them escape from some of their worries and lessen stress on their lives.
 I have kids, and I know they don't even care about the news one little bit, unless it has something to do with video games of course. Just like all the other normal kids. i don't think they are bad citizens. Many old folks

Are We Being Bad Citizens If We Don't Keep Up With the News?

More than likely, like myself, people get sick and tired of hearing all the violence and terrorism around the world and just want to tune out and not dwell on it, and focus on the positives in their life.

It's almost impossible to not know what's in the news this day and age anyways, due to word of mouth and stuff like that. You always have a friend or family member telling people what they had in the news anyways. The same goes with social media. All throughout social media you see stuff about the news, and people will not hesitate to share it with their followers. So it's hard to avoid. But who can blame a person for wanting to tune out all the negative news and hear something good in their life anyways. 
Do I believe there is a responsibility to know what is going on in the world?
 No, I do not. I feel there are plenty of other people out there who do enough worrying about everything. I feel you should save your energy from worrying, and use it to purify your soul and become a better person. If more people did that, maybe they would become better citizens, who knows. 

Even more so, many people only focus on specific types of news anyways and tune everything else out. I'm sure they feel they are not bad people. 
Maybe they dealize that tuning out some news would greatly help them escape from some of their worries and lessen stress on their lives.

Maybe they dealize that tuning out some news would greatly help them escape from some of their worries and lessen stress on their lives.
 I have kids, and I know they don't even care about the news one little bit, unless it has something to do with video games of course. Just like all the other normal kids. i don't think they are bad citizens. Many old folks do the same. They are not bad people ei

Are We Being Bad Citizens If We Don't Keep Up With the News?

In your opinion, are we being bad citizens if we don't keep up with the news? Do you think all people have some responsibility to know what is going on in the world? Does engaging with current events actually do anything at all? Why do you think the way you do?

---

In my opinion, while yes engaging with the news and current events helps us keep up on the world, it does not by any means make us bad citizens if we don't. I think it is okay to take a break of news sometimes. Often times we just hear about all the bad things going on in the world, or our country. More than likely, like myself, people get sick and tired of hearing all the violence and terrorism around the world and just want to tune out and not dwell on it, and focus on the positives in their life.

It's almost impossible to not know what's in the news this day and age anyways, due to word of mouth and stuff like that. You always have a friend or family member telling people what they had in the news anyways. The same goes with social media. All throughout social media you see stuff about the news, and people will not hesitate to share it with their followers. So it's hard to avoid. But who can blame a person for wanting to tune out all the negative news and hear something good in their life anyways. 
Do I believe there is a responsibility to know what is going on in the world?
 No, I do not. I feel there are plenty of other people out there who do enough worrying about everything. I feel you should save your energy from worrying, and use it to purify your soul and become a better person. If more people did that, maybe they would become better citizens, who knows. 

Even more so, many people only focus on specific types of news anyways and tune everything else out. I'm sure they feel they are not bad people. 
Maybe they dealize that tuning out some news would greatly help them escape from some of their worries and lessen stress on their lives.
 I have kids, and I know they don't even care about the news one little bit, unless it has something to do with video games of course. Just like all the other normal kids. i don't think they are bad citizens. Many old folks do the same. They are not bad people eit

In my opinion, while yes engaging with the news and current events helps us keep up on the world, it does not by any means make us bad citizens if we don't. I think it is okay to take a break of news sometimes. Often times we just hear about all the bad things going on in the world, or our country. More than likely, like myself, people get sick and tired of hearing all the violence and terrorism around the world and just want to tune out and not dwell on it, and focus on the positives in their life.

It's almost impossible to not know what's in the news this day and age anyways, due to word of mouth and stuff like that. You always have a friend or family member telling people what they had in the news anyways. The same goes with social media. All throughout social media you see stuff about the news, and people will not hesitate to share it with their followers. So it's hard to avoid. But who can blame a person for wanting to tune out all the negative news and hear something good in their life anyways. 
Do I believe there is a responsibility to know what is going on in the world?
 No, I do not. I feel there are plenty of other people out there who do enough worrying about everything. I feel you should save your energy from worrying, and use it to purify your soul and become a better person. If more people did that, maybe they would become better citizens, who knows. 

Even more so, many people only focus on specific types of news anyways and tune everything else out. I'm sure they feel they are not bad people. 
Maybe they dealize that tuning out some news would greatly help them escape from some of their worries and lessen stress on their lives.
 I have kids, and I know they don't even care about the news one little bit, unless it has something to do with video games of course. Just like all the other normal kids. i don't think they are bad citizens. Many old folks do the same. They are not bad people or citiz
